bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a discipline hearing has not yet begun, to the investigation committee, or
if a discipline hearing has begun, to the discipline committee.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A registrant's written proposal

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: must describe the nature of the matter that is or will be the subject of the discipline hearing,
must include the registrant's consent to the making of an order, as set out in the proposal, under one or more of the following provisions:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: section 61 (1) (b);
section 61 (2);
section 61 (4), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may include the registrant's consent to indemnify the college for costs in an amount not greater than the amount that could be awarded if an award of costs were made by the discipline committee under section 63 [cost awards by discipline committee], including, if the proposal is given to the investigation committee fewer than 7 days before a discipline hearing is scheduled to commence, costs of preparing for the discipline hearing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Based on the investigation, the investigation committee or the discipline committee, as applicable, may in its discretion accept, reject or request changes to a registrant's proposal.
If a registrant's proposal is accepted under subsection (3), the committee that accepts the proposal must make an order consistent with that proposal.
If an order is made under subsection (4),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the order is deemed to be an order of the discipline committee made under section 61 [action by discipline committee], and
the discipline hearing is cancelled.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an order made under subsection (4) includes costs, section 63 (5) applies as if an award of costs had been made by the discipline committee.
If the investigation committee or the discipline committee rejects a registrant's proposal,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a discipline hearing, if a hearing proceeds, must proceed as if the proposal had not been made, and
the discipline committee must not consider the proposal in

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: determining the matter,
making an order under section 61, or
awarding costs under section 63.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), the investigation committee or discipline committee, as applicable, must direct the registrar to notify the public of the information set out in subsection (2) in respect of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: an order made by the discipline committee under section 61 [action by discipline committee];
an action taken by the investigation committee or discipline committee under section 65 (2) [extraordinary action to protect public interest];
an undertaking or consent given in relation to a request by the investigation committee under section 66 (1) [reprimand or remedial action by consent];
a consent order made by the investigation committee or discipline committee under section 67 [consent orders];
any additional matter prescribed by regulation of the minister or required under the bylaws.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The following information must be included in a public notice required under subsection (1):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the name of the registrant in respect of whom the action was taken;
a description of the action taken;
the reasons for the action taken.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The investigation committee or the discipline committee, as applicable, may direct the registrar to withhold all or part of the information otherwise required, by subsections (1) and (2), to be included in a public notice if the investigation committee or discipline committee considers that the public interest in public notice of the information is outweighed by the privacy interests of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the complainant or another person, other than the registrant, affected by the matter, or
in the case of information that relates to a condition described in section 61 (1) (b) (vi), the registrant.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If information respecting a registrant is withheld under subsection (3) (b), the public notice must indicate that information has been withheld.
A public notice required under this section must be made

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: by posting the notice in a prominent place on the college website, and
in accordance with any additional requirements prescribed by regulation of the minister.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Application of this Part to certified technicians

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Division, certified technician includes a former certified technician.
This Part applies to a certified technician as if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certified technician were a registrant,

references in this Part to practising veterinary medicine or the practice of veterinary medicine were references to those aspects of the practice of veterinary medicine that the certified technician is authorized to provide or perform in accordance with this Act, the regulations and the bylaws,

in section 49 (3) (c) [inspections], the words "inspect or observe the practice of veterinary medicine performed by a registrant or under the supervision of a registrant" were replaced with "inspect or observe the aspects of the practice of veterinary medicine performed by a certified technician", and
the certification of the certified technician were the registration of a registrant or respondent, as applicable.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exercise of powers by registrar and committees
bcl:section.bcl:text: In exercising any powers or performing any duties under this Act, the following must act in accordance with this Act, the regulations and the bylaws:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registrar, a deputy registrar, an inspector and an officer of the college;
a committee or panel of a committee established under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, protected individual means any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registrar;
a deputy registrar;
an inspector;
a member of the council;
a member of the registration, investigation or discipline committee;
an officer or a member of a committee authorized by bylaw to determine an application for certification as a certified technician.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (3), no legal proceeding for damages lies or may be commenced or maintained against a protected individual because of anything done or omitted

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the exercise or intended exercise of any power under this Act, or
in the performance or intended performance of any duty under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (2) does not apply to a person referred to in that subsection in relation to anything done or omitted by that person in bad faith.

Subsection (2) does not absolve the college from vicarious liability arising out of anything done or omitted by a person referred to in that subsection for which the college would be vicariously liable if this section were not in force.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Responsibility of registrants not affected by incorporation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The liability of a registrant for professional negligence is not affected by the fact that the registrant practises veterinary medicine as an employee of a corporation.

The relationship of a registrant to a corporation, whether as a shareholder, director, officer, agent, trustee, contractor or employee of the corporation, does not affect, modify or diminish the application to the registrant of this Act, the regulations and the bylaws.

Nothing in this Act affects, modifies or limits any law that applies to the fiduciary, confidential or ethical obligations between a registrant and a person receiving veterinary medicine services from the registrant.

The relationship between a corporation and a person receiving veterinary medicine services provided by a registrant through the corporation is subject to all applicable laws relating to the fiduciary, confidential and ethical relationships that exist between a registrant and the registrant's client.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Responsibility of certified technicians not affected by incorporation
bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 72 applies to a certified technician and a former certified technician as if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the certified technician were a registrant,
the former certified technician were a former registrant, and

references to veterinary medicine services or to practising veterinary medicine were references to the services or practises that the certified technician is authorized to provide or perform in accordance with this Act, the regulations and the bylaws.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A person who contravenes either of the following commits an offence:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 46 (2) [prohibitions regarding practice of veterinary medicine];
section 47 (1) or (2) [prohibitions regarding registration and use of titles].

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Section 5 of the Offence Act does not apply to this Act, the regulations or the bylaws.
A prosecution for an offence under this Act must not be commenced more than 2 years from the date of the alleged offence.
The college may apply to the Supreme Court for an injunction to restrain a person from contravening any provision of this Act, the regulations or the bylaws.

The court may grant an injunction sought under subsection (1) if the court is satisfied that there is reason to believe that there has been or will be a contravention of this Act, the regulation or the bylaws.
The court may grant an interim injunction pending the outcome of an application commenced under subsection (1).

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who obtains confidential information or records while exercising a power or performing a duty under this Act or the former Act must not disclose the information or records except

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for the purposes of exercising a power or performing a duty under this Act,
as authorized by the council as being in the public interest,
in a proceeding under this Act,
as authorized under this Act, or
as required by law.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a notice or other record is required to be delivered to a person under this Act and is sent by registered mail, it is deemed to have been received by the person 7 days after the date on which it was mailed,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in the case of a registrant, to the last address for that registrant recorded in the register, and
in any other case, to the last address of that person known to the sender.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If a notice or record is not delivered to a person in accordance with this Act, the regulations or the bylaws, a proceeding to which the notice or record relates is not invalidated if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the contents of the notice or record were substantially known by the person within the time allowed for service, or
the failure to deliver does not result in prejudice to the person, or any resulting prejudice can be satisfactorily addressed by an adjournment or by other means.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Regulations of Lieutenant Governor in Council

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: prescribing services for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "veterinary medicine" in section 1 [definitions];
prescribing activities for the purposes of section 46 (3) (i) [prohibitions regarding practice of veterinary medicine] and specifying limits or conditions respecting those activities;
defining any word or expression used but not defined in this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Regulations under this section may provide differently for different classes of persons.
The minister may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the Interpretation Act.
Without limiting subsection (1), the minister may make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: requiring that the council or a committee established under this Act open its meetings to attendance by one or more of the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: registrants;
certified technicians;
members of the public;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of a regulation under paragraph (a), prescribing the circumstances in which the council or a committee established under this Act may exclude registrants, certified technicians or members of the public from meetings of the council or the committee;
respecting how the registrar is to maintain, make open to the public and otherwise administer the register and former register;
prescribing additional information for the purposes of section 39 (2) (i) [register];
in respect of the online registry,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: respecting how the council is to establish, and how the registrar is to maintain, make open to the public and otherwise administer, the online registry, and
prescribing additional information for the purposes of section 41 (2) (g) [online registry];

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: in respect of public notices required under section 68 [public notification],

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: prescribing additional matters for the purposes of section 68 (1) (e), and
prescribing additional requirements for the purposes of section 68 (5) (b).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Regulations under this section may provide differently for different classes of persons.

bcl:section.bcl:text: To the extent of any conflict or inconsistency between a regulation under section 78 or 79 and a bylaw, the regulation prevails.
In this Division, former council means the council of the association under the former Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 4 [council] of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: until 3 council members referred to in section 4 (2) (a) are first elected under this Act, the council consists of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the members of the former council, and
the individuals, if any, appointed by order of the minister under the former Act or under section 4 (2) (c) of this Act, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister may by order specify the date on or before which the first election must be held to elect the council members referred to in section 4 (2) (a) of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For greater certainty, if an individual is appointed by the minister before the first council election under this Act, that individual continues to be a council member after the election, subject to the terms of the individual's appointment.

A person who, immediately before the repeal of the former Act, is a registered member of the association, is deemed to be a registrant under this Act, and the person's registration is subject to the same restrictions, terms, conditions and requirements as under the former Act until the person's registration is varied or cancelled under this Act.

If the practice of a person described in subsection (1) is subject to a condition imposed under section 17 (3) (b) of the former Act, the person is, for the purposes of section 61 (3) [action by discipline committee] of this Act, deemed to be a registrant whose practice is subject to a condition imposed under section 61 (2) (b) of this Act.

If, immediately before the repeal of the former Act, a person's practice is under suspension and the person's registration is deemed erased under section 18 of the former Act, the person is deemed to be a registrant under this Act, but until the suspension period ends, the person's registration is deemed to be suspended under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — registration applications made but not determined under former Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: An application made under the former Act for registration or for renewal or reinstatement of registration that has not been determined must be determined under this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — complaint made but inquiry committee not appointed under former Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, before the repeal of the former Act, a complaint or request for an inquiry was made, but the former council has not appointed an inquiry committee under section 15 of the former Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the former council must not appoint an inquiry committee, but instead must forward the complaint or request to the registrar in writing, and
the registrar must proceed with the complaint or request as if it were a written complaint received by the registrar under section 50 (1) [complaints to be made to registrar] of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subsection (1) does not apply if, before the repeal of the former Act, the former council decided under section 15 of the former Act that it would not cause an inquiry to be made.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — inquiry committee appointed but hearing not started under former Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: If, before the repeal of the former Act, an inquiry committee was appointed under section 15 of the former Act, but the inquiry committee has not started to hear and decide on the facts surrounding the charge or complaint under section 17 (1) (a) of the former Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the inquiry committee must not hear and decide on the facts, but instead must forward the charge or complaint to the investigation committee under this Act, and

the investigation committee must proceed with the charge or complaint under Division 2 [Complaints and Investigations] of Part 4 of this Act as if the charge or complaint were a complaint received from the registrar under section 50 (2) of this Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — inquiry hearing started but complaint not considered by former council

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, before the repeal of the former Act, an inquiry committee appointed under section 15 of the former Act started to hear and decide on the facts surrounding a charge or complaint under section 17 (1) (a) of the former Act, but has not reported its findings to the former council under section 17 (1) (c) of the former Act, the inquiry committee must proceed with the charge or complaint in accordance with subsection (2) of this section.
Subject to subsection (4), the inquiry committee referred in subsection (1) must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: continue the hearing, decide on the facts surrounding the charge or complaint and make findings under section 17 (1) (a) and (b) of the former Act, as if section 17 (1) (a) and (b) of the former Act were still in force, and

after making findings under section 17 (1) (b) of the former Act, act under section 57 [action by investigation committee] of this Act, as if the inquiry committee were the investigation committee under section 57 of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, before the repeal of the former Act, an inquiry committee appointed under section 15 of the former Act reported its findings to the former council under section 17 (1) (c) of the former Act, but the former council has not started to consider the inquiry committee's report,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the former council must not consider the inquiry committee's report, but instead must return the report to the inquiry committee, and
subject to subsection (4) of this section, the inquiry committee must act under section 57 of this Act, as if the inquiry committee were the investigation committee under section 57 of this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Sections 65 to 67 of this Act apply under subsections (2) and (3) of this section, as if the inquiry committee were the investigation committee under sections 65 to 67 of this Act.
If, under this section, the inquiry committee directs the registrar to issue a citation under section 58 of this Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the inquiry committee must make a written report of the findings referred to in subsection (2) or (3) of this section, as applicable,
the inquiry committee must send the written report to the registrar, and
the registrar must deliver the written report to the registrant, together with the citation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In a discipline proceeding for which a citation is issued under this section, the discipline committee is bound by the findings set out in an inquiry committee's written report.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — complaint under consideration but not determined by former council

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, before the repeal of the former Act, the former council started to consider findings reported by an inquiry committee under section 17 (1) (c) of the former Act, but the former council has not acted under section 17 (2) to (4) of the former Act, the former council must act under section 17 (2) to (4) of the former Act, as if those sections were still in force, except that under section 17 (3) (c) of the former Act, the former council must not direct that a registrant's name be erased from the register, but instead may cancel the registrant's registration.
If, under subsection (1), the former council

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: restricts a registrant's practice, section 61 (3) [action by discipline committee] of this Act applies as if the restriction were a limit or condition imposed under section 61 (2) (b) of this Act, or
suspends a registrant from practice, section 18 of the former Act does not apply.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, under this section, the former council makes a determination or acts under section 17 (2) or (3) of the former Act, the determination or act is deemed to be an order of the discipline committee made under section 61 of this Act.
The register and the online registry must be established no later than 6 months after the coming into force of this section.
In respect of the register,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the limits and conditions referred to in section 39 (2) (e) of this Act include all limits or conditions, if any, imposed on the individual before the coming into force of that section,

the terms, conditions or requirements referred to in section 39 (2) (f) of this Act include all terms, conditions or requirements, if any, imposed on the individual before the coming into force of that section,
the disciplinary actions referred to in section 39 (2) (g) of this Act include all disciplinary actions, if any, taken in respect of the individual before the coming into force of that section, and

the cancellations or suspensions referred to in section 39 (2) (h) of this Act include all cancellations and suspensions, if any, made in respect of the individual before the coming into force of that section.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In respect of the online registry,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the disciplinary actions referred to in section 41 (2) (e) of this Act include all disciplinary actions, if any, taken not more than 5 years before the date of the coming into force of that section, and

the cancellations or suspensions referred to in section 41 (2) (f) of this Act include all cancellations and suspensions, if any, made not more than 5 years before the date of the coming into force of that section.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transition — references to British Columbia Veterinary Medical Association
bcl:section.bcl:text: A reference to the British Columbia Veterinary Medical Association in any record, including, without limitation, in any security agreement, commercial paper, lease, licence, permit or other contract, instrument, document or certificate, is deemed to be a reference to the College of Veterinarians of British Columbia.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may make regulations the minister considers necessary or advisable for the orderly transition from the former Act to this Act.
The authority to make or amend a regulation under subsection (1), but not the authority to repeal a regulation made under subsection (1), ends 2 years after the coming into force of this section.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The Veterinarians Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 476, is repealed.

bcl:editorialnote.in:em: [Note: See Table of Legislative Changes for the status of sections 93 to 103.]

in:doc.bcl:link: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act
Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act
Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Act

bcl:section.bcl:text: The provisions of this Act referred to in column 1 of the following table come into force as set out in column 2 of the table:

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Anything not elsewhere covered by this table
By regulation of the Lieutenant Governor in Council
